intro: Hibbertia sulcata, commonly known as the serrated hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, serrated leaves. The plant produces yellow, tubular flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Hibbertia sulcata is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is a shrub that can grow up to 1 meter in height, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves.
